alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Henry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 3:00PM CDT until July 18 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR BENTON...CARROLL AND SOUTHEASTERN HENRY COUNTIES... At 258 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Waverly to near Parkers Crossroads, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 242 PM CDT, trained spotters measured 63 mph wind gusts in Big Sandy and numerous trees were down across Carroll County. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... McKenzie, Huntingdon, Camden, Bruceton, Atwood, Vale, Springville, Trezevant, Hollow Rock, Big Sandy, McLemoresville, Howley, Hillard, Mansfield, Old Springville, Leach, Tate, Palmer Shelter, Ephesus and Buena Vista. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
